intro: Gnidiopsis carinata, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent-like leaves. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to dry conditions. Its structure includes a short, branching stem with opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Gnidiopsis carinata is known for its ability to thrive in sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
